column2: Label
column4: Definition Source

column2: AL rdfs:label@en
column4: AL IAO:0000119@en

column2: Dental attrition score
column3: A categorical label denoting a specific dental attrition state.

column2: No information available
column3: No information available (tooth not occluding, unerupted, antemortem or postmortem loss, etc.).
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: Wear facets invisible or very small
column3: Wear facets invisible or very small.
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: Wear facets large, but large cusps still present and surface features very evident
column3:
Wear facets large, but large cusps still present and surface features (crenulations, noncarious pits) very evident. It is
possible to have pinprick size dentine exposures or “dots” which should be ignored. This is a quadrant with much enamel.
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: Any cusp in the quadrant area is rounded
column3: Any cusp in the quadrant area is rounded rather than being clearly defined as in 'Wear facets large, but large cusps still present and surface features very evident'. The cusp is becoming obliterated but is not yet worn flat.
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: Quadrant area is worn flat but there is no dentine exposure
column3: Quadrant area is worn flat (horizontal) but there is no dentine exposure other than a possible pinprick sized “dot.”
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: Dentine exposure one-fourth of quadrant or less.
column3: Quadrant is flat, with dentine exposure one-fourth of quadrant or less. (Be careful not to confuse noncarious pits with dentine exposure.)
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: Dentine exposure more than one fourth of quadrant
column3: Dentine exposure greater: more than one-fourth of quadrant area is involved, but there is still much enamel present. If the quadrant is visualized as having three “sides” (as in the diagram in Scott, 1979, Tab. 1) the dentine patch is still surrounded on all three “sides” by a ring of enamel.
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: Enamel on only two “sides” of the quadrant
column3: Enamel is found on only two “sides” of the quadrant.
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: Enamel on only one “side” of the quadrant, thick to medium
column3: Enamel on only one “side” (usually outer rim) but the enamel is thick to medium on this edge.
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: Enamel on only one “side” of the quadrant, thin
column3: Enamel on only one “side” as in 8, but the enamel is very thin - just a strip. Part of the “edge” may be worn through a t one or more places.
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: Denine exposure complete
column3: No enamel on any part of quadrant - dentine exposure complete. Wear is extended below the cervicoenamel junction into the root.
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: Wear of molars value specification
column3: A value specification that specifies the dental attrition stage observed with a molar tooth.
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.
column10: ('has category label' exactly 1 ({dentalwear:NoInformation, dentalwear:WearFacetsInvisible, dentalwear:WearFacetsLarge, dentalwear:AnyCuspInQuadrantRounded, dentalwear:QuadrantWornFlatNoDentineExposure, dentalwear:UpToOneFourthDentineExposure, dentalwear:OverOneFourthDentineExposure, dentalwear:EnamelOnlyOnTwoSidesOfQuadrant, dentalwear:EnamelOnlyOnOneSideOfQadrantThickToMedium, dentalwear:EnamelOnlyOnOneSideOfQadrantThin, dentalwear:DentineExposureComplete}))

column2: Sorting directive for a wear of molars label
column3: A sorting specification about the position of a category label within the ordinal scale defined by a wear of molars value specification.
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: 00: No information available
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: 01: Wear facets invisible or very small
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: 02: Wear facets large, but large cusps still present and surface features very evident
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: 03: Any cusp in the quadrant area is rounded
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: 04: Quadrant area is worn flat but there is no dentine exposure
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: 05: Quadrant is flat, with dentine exposure one-fourth of quadrant or less
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: 06: Dentine exposure greater: more than one-fourth of quadrant area is involved
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: 07: Enamel is found on only two sides of the quadrant
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: 08: Enamel on only one side (usually outer rim) but the enamel is thick to medium on this edge
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: 09: Enamel on only one side as in 8, but the enamel is very thin---just a strip
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.

column2: 10: No enamel on any part of quadrant, dentine exposure complete
column4: Scott, E. C. (1979). Dental Wear Scoring Technique. Am. J. Phys. Anthrop. 51, Tab. 1.
